headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  LONG, LEON D.

docs.snippet: LONG--Leon D., Age 89, of Dunedin, Florida (formerly of Hicksville, Long Island, New York), passed on Wednesday, August 15, 2012 at Brookside Hospice House in Palm Harbor, Florida. Leon was born in Mississippi, but lived in New York where he was a...
docs.lead_paragraph: LONG--Leon D., Age 89, of Dunedin, Florida (formerly of Hicksville, Long Island, New York), passed on Wednesday, August 15, 2012 at Brookside Hospice House in Palm Harbor, Florida. Leon was born in Mississippi, but lived in New York where he was a Pressman at The New York Times Newspaper for 42 years. He was a Veteran, having served and been wounded in the European Theater during World War II. He was a member of Our Lady of Mercy RC Catholic Church in Hicksville where he served as a Head Usher. He was also a member of the Holy Name Society, The Knights of Columbus and President of The New York Times VFW Post. He loved to travel, enjoyed music and was a voracious reader. Leon is survived by his wife of 65 years, Rita; and five children: daughter, Carol Ann of California; son, James (Eva) of PA.; daughter, Janey Peisker of New York; son, Patrick (Gail) of New York; daughter, Rita of Nevada. He is survived by eight grandchildren and two siblings, a brother, Paul Wise of Texas and a sister, Dean Cummins of Mississippi. Visitation will be at the Vernon C. Wagner Funeral Home 125 West Old Country Rd., Hicksville, Sunday 7-9pm and Monday 2-4 and 7-9pm. Funeral Mass Tuesday 9:30am. at Our Lady of Mercy Catholic RC Church Hicksville. Burial with Military Honors to follow at Calverton National Cemetery. Memorial Donations: In lieu of flowers, please consider a donation in Leon's Memory to Smile Train, The Guidedog Foundation of Smithtown, New York or Suncoast Hospice.

headline.main: Paid Notice: Deaths  CAMPBELL, BASIL R.

docs.snippet: CAMPBELL--Rev. Basil R. - Kane Lodge No. 454 F. & A.M. mourns with profound sorrow the death on August 13, 2012, of our esteemed Chaplain Emeritus Bro. Basil â€œCamâ€ Campbell, D.S.A. A Life Member and recipient of the Dedicated Service A...
docs.lead_paragraph: CAMPBELL--Rev. Basil R. - Kane Lodge No. 454 F. & A.M. mourns with profound sorrow the death on August 13, 2012, of our esteemed Chaplain Emeritus Bro. Basil â€œCamâ€ Campbell, D.S.A. A Life Member and recipient of the Dedicated Service Award, Rev. Cam was raised in Robinson Locke Lodge No. 659, Toledo, Ohio on June 14, 1943 and affiliated with Kane Lodge on September 21, 1976 while serving as the Assistant Head Master at the Browning School in New York City. He soon became the Chaplain of Kane Lodge. After his retirement in 1987, he relocated to Cary, NC. Bro. Campbell shall be fondly remembered as a true gentleman and friend of Kane Lodge. Alan G. Moore, Secretary Armando 'Sandy' Carles, Master

docs.snippet: PALMER-PORONER--Bruno, 91. On August 9, 2012. Publisher ARTspeak, 1978-1997. Owner of East HamptonGallery, 1961-1975. Survived by his wife Margot, his sons Daniel and Michael and five granddaughters. Veteran of WWII. To be honored by the Navy at L...
docs.lead_paragraph: PALMER-PORONER--Bruno, 91. On August 9, 2012. Publisher ARTspeak, 1978-1997. Owner of East HamptonGallery, 1961-1975. Survived by his wife Margot, his sons Daniel and Michael and five granddaughters. Veteran of WWII. To be honored by the Navy at Long Island National Cemetery, September 7.

docs.snippet: ARNOW--Kathryn Smul, 94, a retired health policy analyst of Washington, D.C., died August 12, in Sarasota, FL of natural causes. Born 1918, in New York City, to Dr. Josef and Ethel Lubell Smul, Kathryn graduated summa cum laude with a B.A. from Ba...
docs.lead_paragraph: ARNOW--Kathryn Smul, 94, a retired health policy analyst of Washington, D.C., died August 12, in Sarasota, FL of natural causes. Born 1918, in New York City, to Dr. Josef and Ethel Lubell Smul, Kathryn graduated summa cum laude with a B.A. from Barnard College, and received her M.A. from Columbia University. Previously married to Philip Arnow (deceased), Kathryn is survived and missed by long-time loving companion Philip Hemily, and by daughter, Amy Arnow Robinson (Karl) of Carlisle, PA; sons, Michael Arnow (Susan), of Silverdale, WA, and Ethan Arnow (Anne-Marie) of Brisbane, Australia; six grandchildren, seven great-grandchildren, and several nieces and nephews. Private services will be conducted at the convenience of the family.

docs.snippet: HARTWELL--Stacy Schatz, 49, passed away at home in Mt. Pleasant, SC surrounded by her sons Max and Jake, mother Nancy Schultz, Father Michael Schatz, and brother Mark Schatz. Our dear daughter, sister and loving mother will be deeply missed. Memor...
docs.lead_paragraph: HARTWELL--Stacy Schatz, 49, passed away at home in Mt. Pleasant, SC surrounded by her sons Max and Jake, mother Nancy Schultz, Father Michael Schatz, and brother Mark Schatz. Our dear daughter, sister and loving mother will be deeply missed. Memorial contributions may be sent to the American Cancer Society or charity of your choice. Services are under the care and direction of Hardage- Giddens Funeral Home, 4115 Hendricks Ave., Jacksonville, FL 32207. (904)346-3808. www.hardage-giddenshen dricksave.com.

docs.snippet: ASTRACHAN--Samuel, novelist, Gordes, France, on August 5th, 2012, after a nearly 20 year battle with Parkinson's disease. Sam Astrachan, born in the Bronx in 1934 to Isaac and Ethel, wrote most of his first novel, "An End to Dying", during his jun...
docs.lead_paragraph: ASTRACHAN--Samuel, novelist, Gordes, France, on August 5th, 2012, after a nearly 20 year battle with Parkinson's disease. Sam Astrachan, born in the Bronx in 1934 to Isaac and Ethel, wrote most of his first novel, "An End to Dying", during his junior and senior years at Columbia University. He married in 1960, and began dividing his time between the South of France and the US. He taught creative writing at Wayne State University in Detroit for one semester of every year starting in 1971 until his retirement in the late 1990s. He is survived by his wife, Claude Jeanneau, sculptor; son Isaac-Daniel, architect; daughter-in-law Meghan Farley, drama director; and grandson, Aidhan Farley, soccer player; as well as his books: "An End to Dying" (1956), "The Game of Dostoevsky" (1965), "Rejoice" (1970), "Katz-Cohen" (1978), "Malaparte in Jassy" (1989,1994), "Hotel Sevilla: Rockaway Beach 1947" (1996), "Le General, ses Filles" (1998), "Dans les Jardins de la Marquise" (1999), "Winston" (2002) "Treife: la Fable de l'Architecte" (2004).

docs.snippet: LEAVITT--Eleanore, August 13, 1923 - August 14, 2012. Beloved wife of Bill. Survived by children Ted, Anne Sexton and Eleanore DeSole, and six grandchildren. A graduate of Kimberley Academy and Connecticut College....

docs.snippet: MARTENS-Harry, died on August 15, 2012 in New York City. He was born in Michigan on October 26, 1930, the son of Harry M. and Naomi A. Martens, and grew up in Saginaw and Bay City. He completed his secondary education at the Cranbrook School in Bl...
docs.lead_paragraph: MARTENS-Harry, died on August 15, 2012 in New York City. He was born in Michigan on October 26, 1930, the son of Harry M. and Naomi A. Martens, and grew up in Saginaw and Bay City. He completed his secondary education at the Cranbrook School in Bloomfield Hills, Michigan. He attended Yale University, where he received his B.A. in 1953. After serving in the United States Army, he enrolled at the University of Michigan Law School. Upon receiving his J.D. in 1959, he moved to New York City, where he lived for the remainder of his adult life. He joined the firm of Shearman & Sterling & Wright (as it was then known) as an associate. After a few years, however, he left the practice of law to establish the Caliban restaurant on Third Avenue near 26th Street. He owned and operated Caliban for over 30 years, until it was sold and the name changed. He is survived by his brother James A. Martens of Kamuela, Hawaii, his step-brother Jack O'Brien of New Milford, Connecticut, and New York City, and his step-sister Janet E. Stillwell of Kalamazoo, Michigan, among others. He will be missed by them and by many friends and patrons of Caliban over the years. No services are planned. His remains will be interred at the Long Island National Cemetery in Farmingdale.

docs.snippet: DORISON--Milton. My beloved husband, died on July 7, 2012 after a long time suffering. He died of a heart attack. He would have been 100 years old August 14. With all my love, his grieving wife, Mila Dorison....
docs.lead_paragraph: DORISON--Milton. My beloved husband, died on July 7, 2012 after a long time suffering. He died of a heart attack. He would have been 100 years old August 14. With all my love, his grieving wife, Mila Dorison.
